nodes.bodyText: maybe declare this variable more close to the place where it is used.
fixed

hm... credentials - is a local variable here. Maybe we can omit _<%=cid%>
The only thing to pay attention is the fact that this class is a local class in a big method.
So, local variables from the outer method are also visible inside this class methods.
Also I need to check if there are several local classes which use  the same variable names in their methods.
fixed
fixed

<% if(isLog4jEnabled) { %>
			log.info("<%=cid%> - query " + <%=query%>);
		<% } %>

seems, this logging is not related to buildBigQuery() private method
Furthermore I see that this code wasn't removed from begin.javajet
I think it should be removed from here, but remain in begin. javajet
fixed

[caching]
I suggest to add caching for BigQuery service.
As I understand following algorithm is used in case of Result size auto mode:

try small size
if ok -> finish
if not ok, try large size
finish
When small size is not ok the code will call buildBigQuery() method twice. It will read credentials file twice.
It would be good to build BigQuery instance only once.
So, add an if condition which checks whether BigQuery was built already. If yes -> use existing. If no -> build it.
fixed

I suggest to change com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration.Builder parameter to com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration (pass QueryJobConfiguration as parameter instead of its Builder)
It's ok here as it is private method, which you may change whenever you want. But generally from my point of you it's not to pass Builder as parameter in the middle of buildilng progress.
Imagine, that you don't know what method does with builder inside.
So, you as user of such method should guess the state of builder you need to pass. Should it be fresh builder and method will do all the building. Or should it be already configured builder (as in your case) and method will call only build() inside.
please, remove extra spaces here
remove extra space here before .setDryRun

I would suggest do not split queryConfiguration_ builging.
Maybe we can use 2 builder in this method:

for jobConfDryRun_

com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration jobConfDryRun_<%=cid%> = com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration.newBuilder(query)
    .setUseLegacySql(useLegacySql)
    .setDryRun(true)
    .build();


for queryConfiguration_ :

com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration.Builder queryConfiguration_<%=cid%> = com.google.cloud.bigquery.QueryJobConfiguration.newBuilder(query)
    .setUseLegacySql(useLegacySql)
    .setDryRun(false)
    .setAllowLargeResults(true)		 
    .setDestinationTable(com.google.cloud.bigquery.TableId.of(tempDataset_<%=cid%>, tempTable))
    .build();

!!!
This part is missed in new code.
Think/check what happened if user switch Result size to small

[caching] [minor]
I suggest to rename local variable "bigquery" to "bigQueryClient" or "client" or "result"
or you may even do
return com.google.cloud.bigquery.BigQueryOptions.newBuilder()
                        .setCredentials(credentials)
			.setProjectId(<%=projectId%>)
			.build()
			.getService();

The problem is that local variable has the same name as class field.
Generally, it's ok for Java code. But I think it's not ok for javajet as IDE won't help you to see usages

[caching]
if (bigQuery == null) {
	bigQuery = buildBigQuery();
}

I think this is not a good idea. In this case callers should control caching.
When you call buildBigQuery() method in executeQuerySmallResult() and executeQueryLargeResult() you should think how to cache bigQuery correctly.
Imagine you have 5 methods instead of 2.
In that case you will need to duplicate if (bigQuery == null) 4 times.
I think it is better to move this if (bigQuery == null) to buildBigQuery() method
(the idea is similar to Singleton pattern)
Another way to fix is:

call buildBigQuery() only in Constructor
In  executeQuerySmallResult() and executeQueryLargeResult() methods use bigQuery field (which initialized in Constructor)

[minor]
Now we get this.useLargeResult = "LARGE".equals("SMALL"); in generated code
Probably we can do here something like:
this.useLargeResult = <% "LARGE".equals(resultSizeType) ? %> true; <% : %> false;

If above doesn't work, it's ok to leave as is

formatting is not fixed:
See 2 lines with "log.info" in this method. Please, make indent consistant.
Either use indent for both (and all other cases in this file) or don't use it

please, use the same indent style.
Here, I can see 2 tabs
if(isLog4jEnabled) should have indent here as it is inside if (isCustomTemporaryName) { block

just a comment for future (not necessary to fix now)
You may not generate this executeQuerySmallResult() method at all when "Large" resultSizeType is chosen
e.g.
<% if("SMALL".equals(resultSizeType)) { %>
private com.google.cloud.bigquery.Job executeQuerySmallResult(...) {
    ...
}
<% } %>

However, I think it's ok as is.
My suggestion complicates code a bit

[trivial] (not necessarily to fix)
I would use following code here:
		<% if ("SMALL".equals(resultSizeType)) { %>
		    job = executeQuerySmallResult(query, useLegacySql);
		<% } %>
                <% if ("LARGE".equals(resultSizeType)) { %>
		    job = executeQueryLargeResult(query, useLegacySql);
		<% } %>
                <% if ("AUTO".equals(resultSizeType)) { %>
                    try ...
                <% } %>

(It's analogue of switch-case)
In the code above it is more clear, which code is generated, when specific property value is used.
(In your code it is a bit harder to guess that last else is related to AUTO resultSizeType value)
But it's ok as is
